meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Lewis Black Clarence Page Chuck Todd Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6379.

div.div:
2012 Power Players Week game 4.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

td.p: Lewis Black, a stand-up comedian from Lewis Black's Root of All Evil
Clarence Page, a journalist from The Chicago Tribune
Chuck Todd, a journalist and chief White House correspondent from NBC News and Meet the Press

tr.td: THE DAILY RUNDOWN
ART & ARTISTS
SUPER PACKS
PAGE TURNERS
THE CONGRESSIONAL RECORD
FADE TO "BLACK"

tr.td: SPORTING EVENTS
First held in May 1875, it is the oldest continuously held major sporting event in the United States
Chuck
Clarence
Lewis
Winner: $50,000 to Samaritan Inns
2nd place: $10,000 to the American Institute for Stuttering
3rd place: $10,000 to the 52nd St. Project and the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation
Chuck
Clarence
Lewis

(including 2 DDs),

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
